_goal.description: How to End your Randomized playthrough.

description: To interact with anything in a town (enter houses, talk to cars, etc.), you must 'unlock' it first.
In 'Decorations' mode, you must obtain one of the garage decorations associated with that town.
Every town has 2. (A couple of towns lacking garage decorations use garage wallpapers instead.)
In 'Stamps' mode, 100 stamp items are added into the pool. Every 5 stamps you get unlocks the next town.
For roughly half of the stamps in the game, the player also receives a reward from an NPC immediately prior
to receiving the stamp. Since NPC rewards and stamps are both loctions, this essentially means the player
is rewarded twice.
If using Decorations mode, enable this to remove those stamps from the location pool. The stamp and NPC reward
are combined into one location.
This cannot be enabled in 'Stamps' mode, as it would bring the number of locations well below the number of items.
Increases the likelihood of receiving a Progressive or Useful item as a reward for a race.
Before items are placed, a random number between 1 and 100 is rolled for each race.
If the number is equal to or below the selected value, the item will be guaranteed to be Progression or Useful.
This provides more incentive to complete races, which are more skill-intensive and time-consuming than most stamps.
Since this is rolled for *each* race, it is not a guarantee that a certain percentage of races will have
Progressive or Useful items - just that on average, they will.
Increases the likelihood of receiving a Progressive or Useful item as a reward for most minigames.
Same as the above, but for minigames. Several minigames are not included due to the lack of a
meaningful challenge (notably Q's Rally, fishing, and the Figure 8 courses, since none of these
have time limits).
Add additional progressive item tracks to the item pool. Defaults to 2, one for each of your teammates.
These parts can be used to equip your teammates, but can also be used by you, or just sold for money
at the Recycle Shop.
Setting to 0 is not recommended, as it makes finding part upgrades a bit rare.
However, for Stamps mode, leaving at default will require the removal of a large number of filler items.
Set to 1 to remove only garage decorations and wallpapers from the item pool in order to make room.
Set to 0 to retain all filler items - but be aware this will likely slow down progress.
